StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The EVE Asthma Genetics Consortium: Building Upon GWAS

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We acknowledge the EVE Consortium Investigators, study personnel, and study subjects, and grants from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute HL101651, HL087665, HL085197, HL070831, HL072414, HL049596, HL064307, HL064313, HL075419, HL65899, HL083069, HL066289, HL087680, HL101543, HL079055, HL087699, HL049612, HL075417, HL04266, HL072433, HL061768, HL076647, HL078885, HL088133, HL069167, HL69116, HL69130, HL69149, HL69155, HL69167, HL69170, HL69174, and HL69349; the National Institutes of Allergy and Infectious Disease, AI070503, AI079139, AI061774, AI050024, AI044840, AI041040, and AI077439; the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases, DK064695; the National Institutes of Environmental Health Sciences, ES09606, ES018176, ES015903, ES007048, ES009581, R826708, RD831861, ES011627, and ES015794; the Division of Intramural Research, ZO1 ES049019; the National Center for Research Resources, RR03048; the Environmental Protection Agency, 83213901 and R-826724; the American Asthma Foundation and the Fund for Henry Ford Hospital; the Mary Beryl Patch Turnbull Scholar Program; the National Council of Science and Technology (Mexico), 26206-M; the Centers for Disease Control, U.S.; the Eudowood Foundation; the Flight Attendant Medical Research Institute (FAMRI); Robert Wood Johnson Foundation (RWJF) Amos Medical Faculty Development Award; the American Asthma Foundation; the Sandler Foundation; the Allergy, Genes and Environment Network, a member of the Networks of Centres of Excellence; the Canadian Institutes for Health Research; and a Tier II Canadian Research Chair and a scholar award from the Michael Smith Foundation for Health Research.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: These data will be used only for research purposes. They may not be used to determine the individual identity of any person. The informed consent document signed by participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit organizations only. Direct use of these data by private companies to develop diagnostics or therapeutics is not allowed under the consent. This consent group does not require IRB approval.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
These data will be used only for research purposes. They may not be used to determine the individual identity of any person. The informed consent document signed by participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit organizations only. Direct use of these data by private companies to develop diagnostics or therapeutics is not allowed under the consent. This consent group does not require IRB approval.
